business.headline: Explained: What rising demand for gold says about global economy As inflation worries persist and geopolitical risks grow, is the world turning to gold because economies are strengthening or because everyone is preparing for tougher financial times ahead?

Man calls Zerodha's Rs 5 crore withdrawal limit scam. Expert explains why it's notZerodha, India's largest retail brokerage platform, was blocking an investor's fund withdrawal. He called the incident a "scam" and accused the company of using his money for free.

Home prices surge up to 19% in top cities. Why buying is getting tougherFresh data from PropTiger shows property prices jumping 7% to 19% in the July to September quarter. Read to know the factors driving the surge in prices.

Can gold prices climb past Rs 1,25,000 again? Here's all you need to knowGlobal politics, central bank moves and investor nerves are all tightening the screws. Will gold finally get the spark it needs to push past the Rs 1.25 lakh mark?

Finance Buddha IPO: Anchor book oversubscribed before issue opening on November 6The IPO consists entirely of a fresh issue of 50.48 lakh shares in the price band of Rs 140 to Rs 142 per share. The issue opens for subscription on November 6 and closes on November 10.

Paytm delivers Rs 211 crore profit in Q2FY26, driven by AI-Led efficiency and cost disciplineOperating revenue grew 24% year-on-year to Rs 2,061 crore, led by growth in subscription merchants, higher Gross Merchandise Value (GMV), and continued expansion in financial services.

Unconditional cash transfers to women increasing fiscal pressure on states: ReportThe report notes that the number of states implementing UCT schemes for women has increased sharply from just two in 2022–23 to twelve in 2025–26.

Nvidia joins India Deep Tech Alliance as group secures $850 million boostThe alliance, launched in September 2025 with an initial commitment of $1 billion, aims to close the funding gap faced by research-driven startups in India.

China suspends 24% tariff on US goods for a year, keeps 10% levyThe announcement comes shortly after last week's meeting between Chinese President Xi Jinping and US President Donald Trump, which marked a step towards easing trade tensions between the world's two largest economies.

Tougher renewable norms may cloud India's clean energy growth: ReportThe proposed regulations, introduced by the Central Electricity Regulatory Commission (CERC) in September 2025, aim to make renewable power suppliers more accountable for maintaining grid discipline.

Guru Nanak Jayanti holiday: Is stock market open or closed for trading today?Apart from the scheduled holidays, the stock market also remains closed on all Saturdays and Sundays as part of the regular weekend schedule.

Nobody bigger than institution: Mehli Mistry in parting note to Tata Trust trusteesIn a letter addressed to all trustees, including Chairman Noel Tata, Mistry wrote that his loyalty to Ratan N Tata's vision comes with a duty to keep the Tata Trusts free from controversy. He noted that any escalation of internal matters could cause lasting damage to the organisation's reputation.

Reliance Group clarifies: ED-attached assets belong to Rcom, business unaffectedReliance Group said that the action has no impact on the business operations of Reliance Infrastructure and Reliance Power.

Is India's tax system fueling the IPO rush? Zerodha's Nithin Kamath thinks soIndia's booming startup economy may be running on a system that rewards valuation over value, and growth over resilience, says Nithin Kamath.

Hinduja Group Chairman Gopichand P Hinduja dies at London hospitalGopichand P Hinduja, who represented the second generation of the influential business family, took charge of the multinational Hinduja Group in May 2023, following the death of his elder brother, Srichand P Hinduja.
Sensex ends 519 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; Eternal down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 519.34 points to close at 83,459.15, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 165.70 points to end at 25,597.65.

Bajaj Finance festive loan volume rises 27% as more first-time borrowers opt for creditThe company added 23 lakh new customers during this period, with 52% of them new to credit. This signals that access to formal borrowing is widening beyond traditional urban consumers.

Caveat filed, battle begins: What's next for Mehli Mistry and Tata TrustsMistry's three-year term as trustee ended on October 28, 2025. A circular was issued on 23 October seeking approval for his reappointment as a life trustee.

Is your money in good shape? 5 financial vitals to check every yearWhen was the last time you checked the health of your finances? Are your savings, investments, and expenses aligned with your goals, or drifting off track? A quick yearly check-up can reveal the answers.

UP government announces 1% recovery relief for rice millers and farmers. Details hereNearly two lakh employment opportunities are expected to get a boost as rice mills expand their operations. It will also increase competition among millers, making procurement faster and more efficient.

entertainment.headline: Dutch writer Marjin De Wit on Ray, Guru Dutt and life-affirming Indian cinema Marjin De Wit, writer of the Dutch film 'Memory Lane', expressed his love for 'Apu trilogy', 'Pyaasa' and 'Mughal-E-Azam', in an exclusive interview with India Today. He also spoke about his film, dealing with ageing, dementia and modern alienation.

Sonali Kulkarni to play a commanding mother in Nani's The Paradise. See poster Actor Sonal Kulkarni will play a powerful role in director Srikanth Odela's 'The Paradise'. The film, starring Nani, will hit theatres on March 26, 2026.

Jatadhara: Sonakshi perfect as demoness, says producer Prerna Arora and shares why In an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, producer Prerna Arora spoke about why Sonakshi Sinha was the perfect choice for 'Jatadhara'. She also explained several challenges faced by the actor on the set.

Kim Soo-hyun demands proper probe into Kim Sae-ron dating controversy South Korean actor Kim Soo Hyun urges authorities to conclude the investigation into his alleged relationship with the late Kim Sae Ron, as protracted proceedings impact his reputation and professional commitments.

Ariana Grande misses Wicked: For Good Brazil premiere due to flight chaos Ariana Grande missed the world premiere of 'Wicked: For Good' in Sao Paulo, Brazil, after a last-minute aircraft safety issue prevented her from travelling, despite extensive efforts to find alternative arrangements.

Vishnuvardhan classic Yajamana set for digitally restored re-release in November The 2000 Kannada blockbuster, Yajamana, featuring the late Dr Vishnuvardhan, is set for a major re-release on November 7 across Karnataka, offering fans a digitally-restored experience.

Bigg Boss Telugu 9 Day 58: Game over bonds in the house, Kalyan out of captaincy race With secret missions, unexpected twists, and a new "rebel" concept, Day 58 brought back the excitement and unpredictability the audience had been waiting for.

Ajay Devgn celebrates 15 years of Golmaal 3, shares old pic with Kareena and Rohit Ajay Devgn marked 15 years of 'Golmaal 3' by sharing a nostalgic throwback photo with the film's cast and director Rohit Shetty. The actor will soon reunite with the team for 'Golmaal 5', which is expected to go on floors in 2026.

The politics of belonging: How Mira Nair's cinema continues in Zohran Mamdani's win When Mira Nair tells stories, she questions them. Now, as her son Zohran Mamdani becomes New York City's youngest Mayor, Nair's lifelong dialogue with politics, identity, and empathy transcends cinema to shape leadership.

KBC 17: Big B left speechless by power line technician's shocking reality Sonu Singh, a power line technician from Haryana, shares first-hand accounts of the dangers faced in his profession during his appearance on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' 17. Singh draws attention to the risks and dedication involved in maintaining the country's electricity supply.

Adarsh Gourav, Shanaya Kapoor wrap Bejoy Nambiar's Tu Yaa Main with 'croc-party' Filming for the romantic thriller 'Tu Yaa Main', starring Adarsh Gourav and Shanaya Kapoor, has wrapped after a multi-location shoot, with the team celebrating on Halloween. The film, directed by Bejoy Nambiar, now heads into post-production ahead of its planned release for Valentine's Day 2026.

Bharti Singh gets emotional while watching Shehnaaz Gill's Ikk Kudi. Video Comedian Bharti Singh was seen getting emotional while watching Shehnaaz Gill's Punjabi film 'Ikk Kudi', and the video quickly went viral online.

Mira Nair beams with pride as son Zohran Mamdani becomes New York's youngest mayor Zohran Mamdani made history by becoming the youngest and first Muslim mayor of New York City, defeating Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa. His win is being celebrated by family and supporters, especially his mother, filmmaker Mira Nair.

Telugu industry values work-life balance: Sonakshi Sinha after Jatadhara shoot Sonakshi Sinha discussed her experience working in the Telugu film industry, emphasising its structured work environment and improved work-life balance compared to Hindi cinema, as she prepares for the release of her debut Telugu film 'Jatadhara'.

Veteran director Suresh Krissna announces new film Anantha, releases poster Director Suresh Krissna has unveiled his latest project, 'Anantha', a biographical film centered on the life of the spiritual leader Sri Sathya Sai Baba. The announcement revealed details about the cast, crew, and production, marking Krissna's return to feature filmmaking.

Ishaan Khatter says Homebound not a failure despite cold box office response Director Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' received acclaim at international festivals but saw a cold box office response. Ishaan Khatter remains hopeful about the film's long-term impact and urges audiences to support niche cinema.

Yellow meets Game of Thrones: Chris reportedly finds love in Sophie Turner According to international media outlets, Chris Martin and Sophie Turner have started seeing each other after both ended previous relationships, with shared interests and a longstanding friendly connection underpinning their new romance.

Salman Khan faces consumer court action over alleged misleading pan masala ad A complaint in Kota Consumer Court against Bollywood actor Salman Khan highlighted concerns over claims made in pan masala advertisements, questioning their truthfulness and influence on young people.

Tom Hiddleston, Olivia Colman return in The Night Manager 2. See first look pics Tom Hiddleston returns as Jonathan Pine in 'The Night Manager Season 2' premiering on Prime Video and BBC. Eight years after its Emmy-winning debut, the popular spy thriller expands beyond John le Carr's novel with a new global story.

general news.headline: Seema, Sweety, who? Rahul Gandhi claims Brazil model 'voted' 22 times in HaryanaA Brazilian model's photograph allegedly appearing 22 times on the Haryana poll rolls became the centrepiece of Rahul Gandhi's explosive voter fraud charge against the BJP and the Election Commission.

Is Rahul Gandhi supporting SIR or opposing it? Election Commission hits backIn an intensified attack against the poll body and the BJP on the eve of the Bihar Assembly polls, Rahul Gandhi claimed 
that a plan was put in place to convert Congress's victory in the 2024 Haryana state elections.  He alleged theft of 25 lakh votes in Haryana, including 5.21 lakh duplicate voters, 93,174 invalid voters and 19.26 lakh bulk voters.

Zohran Mamdani's 'four words for Trump' in electric victory speechZohran Mamdani, who once described himself as Trump's 'worst nightmare', reminded the US President that the city that 'gave rise to him' could also defeat him.

26/11: Did Pak president's nuclear no-first-use offer trigger ISI to attack India?Former adviser of Pakistan president Asif Ali Zardari says the Mumbai 26/11 attacks were a response to his offer of a 'no first use' (of nuclear weapons) to India. But the chronology of facts suggests the attacks would have happened regardless of what he said.

Haq review: Yami-Emraan's film a mature take on faith, law and legacy of Shah BanoRelease Date:Fri Nov 07, 2025Haq movie review: 'Haq' is a powerful film inspired by the Shah Bano case, exploring faith and law. It highlights the struggle for women's dignity amidst societal and religious challenges.

Mira Nair beams with pride as son Zohran Mamdani becomes New York's youngest mayorZohran Mamdani made history by becoming the youngest and first Muslim mayor of New York City, defeating Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa. His win is being celebrated by family and supporters, especially his mother, filmmaker Mira Nair.

No red carpet for Zakir Naik in Bangladesh? Yunus's U-turn with eye on pollsThe Muhammad Yunus government had approved Zakir Naik's visit from November 28 in a major policy shift after the radical preacher was banned by the previous Sheikh Hasina regime.

Mumbai housing society pulls out all stops for coach Amol Mazumdar's homecomingIndia's World Cup-winning women's team coach Amol Muzumdar received an emotional homecoming in Vile Parle, where women from his neighbourhood lined up with raised bats to form a guard of honour as he returned after guiding India to their first ODI World Cup title.

Three Muslims with Indian roots deliver Trump his first big defeatThree Muslim Democrats of Indian origin, Zohran Mamdani, Aftab Pureval, and Ghazala Hashmi, have handed US President Donald Trump his first political setback within months of him becoming the President.

Vreels: A Game-Changing Platform Pushing Social Media Beyond TikTok and InstagramVreels isn't just about sharing, it's about connecting meaningfully. Through built-in chat, voice, and video call features, users can communicate without leaving the app.

Got our a***s handed to us: Vivek Ramaswamy on Democrats sweeping local US pollsDespite their ideological differences, the three Democratic winners -- Zohran Mamdani, Abigail Sherrill, and Mikie Spanberger found common ground on the campaign trail, a shared commitment to tackle the high cost of everyday living.

Sent back just because we are Hindus: Pak turns away 12 pilgrims from Sikh JathaPakistani authorities denied entry to 12 Hindu pilgrims travelling with a Sikh Jatha for Guru Nanak Dev Ji's birth anniversary, sparking controversy. The incident raises concerns over religious freedom and bilateral commitments between India and Pakistan.

Zohran Mamdani's election a silent revolt of Gen ZZohran Mamdani's historic election as New York City's mayor marks a generational turning point, revealing Gen Z's quiet yet determined rebellion against divisive politics through inclusion, collective action, and community-focused governance.

Brazilian photographer's mystery model who's Saraswati, Sweety, Seema in HaryanaCongress leader Rahul Gandhi alleged electoral fraud in Haryana, showing the image of a woman featuring on 22 voter cards in Haryana. That photo turns out to be of a model photographed by Brazilian photographer Matheus Ferrero. Though the model's identity remains a mystery, her photo has long been circulated on stock image platforms and by news portals.

Man gropes, tries to kiss Mexican President in public; security slow to reactMexican President Claudia Sheinbaum faced a shocking security breach when a man groped and attempted to kiss her during a public event in Mexico City. The incident has sparked widespread outrage and raised serious questions about her protection measures.

Ulfat-e-Sitam: Handshakes and hidden knives in the Modi–Trump friendshipTrump's mix of tareefs and threats towards PM has, for now, given Rahul Gandhi constant fodder. In a Bihar election campaign lacking narrative and consistency, the Congress is trying to loosely cling to Trump - whether it's his outrageous claims of stopping an India–Pakistan war or his "dead economy" jibe.
Watch: US YouTuber recreates Tom Cruise's high-risk Mission Impossible plane stuntAmerican YouTuber Michelle Khare recreated Tom Cruise's famous plane stunt from 'Mission: Impossible – Rogue Nation'.

BJP hits back at Rahul Gandhi over Haryana 'Brazilian model' vote rowThe BJP strongly refuted Rahul Gandhi's allegations of voter fraud in the 2024 Haryana Assembly elections, calling them politically motivated. The dispute escalates just before Bihar's crucial polling, highlighting rising tensions between the two parties.

Pokhran 1974: The morning the Buddha smiled on India's nuclear dawnThe story of Pokhran shows how India, despite strong resistance from the West, successfully tested a nuclear bomb. In doing so, it instilled fear in the hearts of its adversaries. The programme became a necessity after China conducted its first test and Pakistan began planning for its own. Despite the lack of plutonium and necessary equipment, India made history and became the sixth nuclear nation in the world.

David Beckham is now Sir David Beckham: Football great knighted by King CharlesDavid Beckham has been formally knighted for his services to football and British society. The former England captain received the honour from King Charles III during a ceremony held at Windsor Castle in Berkshire on Tuesday.

A Bollywood touch in Zohran Mamdani's victory speech ft Dhoom MachaleZohran Mamdani has etched his place in history as New York City's first Muslim mayor, the first of South Asian heritage and the first to be born in Africa. He will also become the city's youngest mayor in more than a century when he takes office on January 1, 2026.
This immortal killer has been hunting lives for 500 million yearsThe researchers noted no other known species creates this exact shell damage pattern, confirming the worms' ancient origins.

The Zohran blueprint: How one New Yorker rewrote the rules of politicsWhat made Mamdani's campaign different was tone. He spoke with a moral clarity that cut through cynicism. He treated voters not as metrics, but as participants in a story about what New York could be. That story resonated most with younger voters, immigrants, and working-class New Yorkers.

Step out from old to new: The Nehru speech Mamdani quoted from | Full textAddressing a crowd of supporters after being elected as NYC Mayor, Zohran Mamdani drew inspiration from Nehru's historic "Tryst with Destiny" speech, delivered on the eve of India's independence in 1947.

sports.headline: Once a king, always a king: Yuvraj, Kuldeep lead wishes for Virat Kohli's birthday Virat Kohli's 37th birthday saw heartfelt wishes pour in from teammates, former players and family, with Yuvraj Singh leading the tributes, celebrating Kohli's passion, legacy and unmatched impact on Indian cricket.

Pakistan media claims Haris Rauf was handed demerit points without prior notice Pakistan fast bowler Haris Rauf was suspended for two matches for breaching the ICC Code of Conduct twice during the Asia Cup. A report in the Pakistan media claimed that the pacer was handed demerit points without prior notice.

India's predicted playing XI for 4th T20I vs Australia: Will Sanju Samson return? India vs Australia 4th T20I, Predicted XI: Sanju Samson is likely to remain on the bench as India are expected to give Jitesh Sharma another opportunity in the fourth T20I of the five-match series against Australia.

Champions India likely to meet President Droupadi Murmu on Nov 6 The World Cup-winning Indian women's cricket team is likely to meet President Droupadi Murmu in New Delhi on November 6. The Harmanpreet Kaur-led side arrived in the national capital on Tuesday evening ahead of their interaction with the Prime Minister.

Cristiano Ronaldo included in Al-Nassr squad for FC Goa clash in Riyadh: Report Cristiano Ronaldo is reportedly set to feature for Al-Nassr against FC Goa in the AFC Champions League 2, raising excitement among Indian fans after his previous absence from the first-leg match in Goa.

World-class Arshdeep Singh understands why he gets dropped: India bowling coach India bowling coach Morne Morkel has backed left-arm pacer Arshdeep Singh, calling him a world-class bowler who understands the team's decision to experiment with different combinations ahead of the T20 World Cup next year.

Harmanpreet Kaur gets World Cup tattoo: Now, I will see you every morning Harmanpreet Kaur immortalises India's Women's World Cup triumph with a tattoo. The victory ends a decades-long wait and highlights the team's perseverance and leadership.

Some compared it to 1983: Sunil Gavaskar on India's seismic Women's World Cup win India's long-awaited Women's World Cup crown has been hailed as one of the nation's greatest cricketing triumphs. Sunil Gavaskar says the victory will shake the world order in women's cricket, inspiring a new generation to dream bigger.

Bangladesh women's cricket team captain accused of beating juniors; board denies Out-of-favour Bangladesh pacer Jahanara Alam has levelled serious allegations against the national board and captain Nigar Sultana Joty, claiming that the current skipper "beats up" junior players in the team "a lot."

Once trolled as the worst, Mahaveer Raghunathan's comeback keeps F1 dream alive Once a figure of trolling and ridicule, Mahaveer Raghunathan has reinvented himself in the Italian GT Championship to keep his Formula One dreams alive. The Indian racer opens up on his journey, recovering from a disastrous F2 campaign and coming out on top.

Sunil Gavaskar says the victory will shake the world order in women's cricket, inspiring a new generation to dream bigger.

Bangladesh women's cricket team captain accused of beating juniors; board denies Out-of-favour Bangladesh pacer Jahanara Alam has levelled serious allegations against the national board and captain Nigar Sultana Joty, claiming that the current skipper "beats up" junior players in the team "a lot."

The Indian racer opens up on his journey, recovering from a disastrous F2 campaign and coming out on top.

ICC Cracks Down: Haris Rauf Banned, Suryakumar Fined After Heated India-Pak Asia Cup ClashesThis special report focuses on the fallout from the fiery Asia Cup clashes between India and Pakistan, with the ICC announcing sanctions against several players for breaching the Code of Conduct. The bulletin highlights that Suryakumar Yadav was accused of making 'politically charged remarks' and snubbing handshakes with Pakistan players, leading to a fine. Pakistan's Haris Rauf has been handed a two-match ban for provocative gestures during the tournament. Additionally, India's Jasprit Bumrah accepted a demerit point for his reactive gesture after dismissing Rauf. The ICC also issued an official warning to Pakistan's Sahibzada Farhan for his controversial 'gun celebration' after scoring a half-century against India during a Super 4 match in Dubai. The sanctions were announced after hearings by the ICC's Elite Panel of Match Referees following incidents in the matches on September 14, 21 and 28.

David Beckham is now Sir David Beckham: Football great knighted by King CharlesDavid Beckham has been formally knighted for his services to football and British society. The former England captain received the honour from King Charles III during a ceremony held at Windsor Castle in Berkshire on Tuesday.

Manchester United's situation is sad, Amorim cannot work wonders: RonaldoCristiano Ronaldo has delivered a brutal assessment of Manchester United's current state, saying manager Ruben Amorim cannot be expected to "work miracles" at Old Trafford and expressing sadness over the club's continued struggles.

Historic Win: India's Queens Arrive To Heroes' Welcome After World Cup Glory!This special report covers the triumphant return of the Indian women's cricket team to Delhi after securing their first-ever ICC Women's ODI World Cup title. After defeating South Africa in a landmark final, the Harmanpreet Kaur-led squad landed in the capital for a scheduled meeting with the Prime Minister. The team received a grand welcome at their hotel, marked by dhol beats, dance, and a special cake-cutting ceremony to celebrate the historic achievement. Players and support staff were greeted with enthusiasm by fans and hotel staff, celebrating the crowning moment for women's cricket in India before they meet the Prime Minister.

India's Women's World Cup win: What it means to a men's cricket fanIndia's title triumph at the Women's World Cup 2025 will go down as one of the greatest moments in the country's cricketing history. For someone who has grown up following the men's game, this victory feels different - it slowly breaks down the invisible barrier that once separated the two teams and draws me closer to the women who are now redefining what Indian cricket stands for.

Champions League: Liverpool beat Real Madrid, 10-man Bayern Munich humble PSGLiverpool secured a narrow 1-0 victory over Real Madrid at Anfield, while Bayern Munich, reduced to ten men, defeated Paris Saint-Germain 2-1 in the Champions League group stage.

Ten boys, one fearless cricketer: How Richa Ghosh was forged in Siliguri's netsRicha Ghosh's World Cup heroics trace their roots back to the dusty nets of Siliguri, where a lone girl trained among boys, forged her fearlessness through sheer grit, and rose to become India's ultimate finisher under pressure.

WPL 2026 Retention: Purse, price slab and all you need to knowThe retentions for the Women's Premier League (WPL) 2026 will take place on November 5, followed by the auction on November 27 in New Delhi. Mumbai Indians will enter the new season as the defending champions, having also lifted the title in 2023.

For someone who has grown up following the men's game, this victory feels different - it slowly breaks down the invisible barrier that once separated the two teams and draws me closer to the women who are now redefining what Indian cricket stands for.

Mumbai Indians will enter the new season as the defending champions, having also lifted the title in 2023.

Ashes: Konstas dropped, Labuschagne recalled in Australia's squad for 1st TestYoung opener Sam Konstas has been left out of Australia's squad for the first Ashes Test against England in Perth, with Marnus Labuschagne earning a recall and uncapped left-hander Jake Weatherald handed a maiden call-up.

Shaheen Afridi era begins as Pakistan survive last-over thriller vs South AfricaFaisalabad witnessed a thrilling finish as Pakistan edged past South Africa by two wickets to take a 1-0 lead in the ODI series, marking a memorable return of international cricket to Iqbal Stadium after 17 years.

Deepti Sharma, Richa Ghosh to be felicitated by football giants East BengalEast Bengal Club will honour Deepti Sharma and Richa Ghosh for their outstanding contributions to India's first Women's World Cup victory, recognising their record-breaking performances and inspiring journeys from Bengal.

Always thought of myself as a world champion: Pratika Rawal after India's victoryWomen's World Cup 2025: Pratika Rawal scored 308 runs from seven matches in the tournament, including a century against New Zealand. Pratika was ruled out of the tournament after the match against Bangladesh due to an ankle and knee injury.

Shafali Verma handled pressure beautifully, immense respect for her: Pratika RawalIn an interview with India Today, Pratika Rawal praised Shafali Verma for her match-winning heroics in the 2025 Women's World Cup final, calling her comeback incredible after stepping in as an injury replacement.

Team India greeted with rousing reception in New Delhi after Women's World Cup winWomen's World Cup 2025: Harmanpreet Kaur's India landed in New Delhi on Tuesday and were greeted with a rousing reception. On November 2, India beat South Africa by 52 runs at the Dr DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai to win the title for the first time.

Radha Yadav's father steals the show on social media, proudly lifts Women's World CupA photo of Radha Yadav's father lifting the Women's ODI World Cup trophy during India's on-field celebrations has gone viral. The moment captured the pride and joy shared by families behind the team's historic first world title.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
